subject: Re: Problem with Method which is expected to throw message
msgSnippet: Thanks For help, ... I have changed as Follows @Test(expected = java.sql.SQLException.class) public void testGetResult() throws Exception { Boolean	result; //
messageBody:
Thanks For help,

>
> You need to change the signature of your public void testGetResult() to include throws Exception, like so:
>
> public void testGetResult() throws Exception {
>

I have changed as Follows

@Test(expected = java.sql.SQLException.class)
public void testGetResult() throws Exception {

Boolean result;

// try {
result = (Boolean) (boolHandler.getResult(getter));
assertEquals("Should Return True", true, result.booleanValue());

result = (Boolean) (boolHandler.getResult(getter));
assertEquals("Should Return False", false, result.booleanValue());

result = (Boolean) (boolHandler.getResult(getter));

// }
// catch (Exception e) {
// e.printStackTrace();
// }
}

but the test ends with following fault and bar is still RED.
with comment on last 'result = ' statement the bar turns GREEN
I expect that when exception is not raised the test should fail.
